history.content:
Yes, you can fulfill tech electives with courses taken while abroad. I think you just need to send the syllabus to cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu for approval.

I'm not sure about L&S breadths, though. You should get into touch with L&S advising to find out about that.

It can be possible to fulfill tech electives for the CS major while studying abroad. Please send us (cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu)the syllabi for the courses that you feel would count as a tech elective for evaluation.

That is possible as well, and many students do fulfill breadths abroad. UCEAP may know what coursework can satisfy breadth, but you should contact your L&S advisors about what is transferable

children.subject: For L&S CS, we only allow 1 course to transfer.

Sorry, on the website it says "You are expected to complete 27 upper division technical units at Berkeley." This seems to contradict that you can satisfy part of your 7 units of tech electives abroad.

that's a good point that the wording is a little confusing, thanks for bringing it to our attention. Here's the full context for everyone else reading this: 

The CS Division single-course restriction

The CS Division allows majors to satisfy at most one upper division course requirement at another four-year institution. Occasional exceptions are made. In either case, you need to make prior arrangements. You are expected to complete 27 upper division technical units at Berkeley. Please note that upper division courses from other four-year institutions can be used toward the upper division unit requirement set by the College of Letters and Science.

You are expected to complete all 27 units here at Berkeley, but we do allow one course to transfer. Something like that - is that better?

I think the whole phrase "You are expected to complete all 27 units here at Berkeley" is misleading. It sounds like you must complete all 27 units at Berkeley, but that's not the case because there is one course transfer allowed.
Is ther a maximum number of units that can be completed abroad counting as a tech elective?

Is it fairly easy to get a tech elective approved? In other words, how often does this happen? Does the class need to meet certain standards, or will any class in EE/CS departments abroad be approved to satisfy the tech elective?

history.content:
Can you fulfill tech electives while studying abroad through UCEAP? If so, what is the process of getting the classes you choose approved and transferred to Berkeley? 

Perhaps not specific enough for EECS advising, but I'll give it a shot anyway: can you fulfill L&S breadths while studying abroad through UCEAP? What is the process of getting the course approved?

Thanks!
history.subject: Fulfilling tech elective in study abroad
